# Hot water storage tank validation experiments
Copyright Brecht Baeten

## Experiment description





## Additional data of the experiments

Order of variables in the data matrix
```
time, V_flow, T_in, T_out, T_sto[1], T_sto[2], T_sto[3], T_sto[4], T_sto[5], T_sto[6], T_sto[7], T_sto[8], T_sto[9], T_sto[10], T_sto[11], T_sto[12], T_sto[13], T_sto[14], T_sto[15], T_sto[16], T_sto[17]
```

`time` is the experiment time in seconds

`V_flow` is the volumetric flow rate in liter per minute. The direction of the flow in the tank is allways from the inflow port to the outflow port.

All temperatures are given in Kelvin

Heights are allways given relative to the bottom of the inside of the storage tank



Height of the temperature measurements T_sto[1]..T_sto[17], relative to the bottom of the tank (m):
```
1.200, 1.165, 1.100, 1.065, 0.950, 0.915, 0.800, 0.765, 0.650, 0.615, 0.500, 0.465, 0.350, 0.315, 0.200, 0.165, 0.050
```

The closest of 50 layers, with layer 1 at the bottom and layer 50 at the top:
```
   48,    47,    44,    43,    38,    37,    32,    31,    26,    25,    20,    18,    14,    12,     8,     6,     2     
```


### Experiment specific data
Heights are given relative to the bottom of the storage tank
Start temperatures are given for 50 layers with layer 1 at the bottom and layer 50 at the top
